intro: Ruellia dielsii, commonly known as the Mexican bluebell, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the southern United States. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub or perennial herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Ruellia dielsii thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shady environments.
